title.narrative: Bangladesh - Primary Education Development Program III

description.narrative: Project Development objectives are to (i) increase participation and reduce social disparities in primary education, (ii) increase the number of children completing primary education and improve the quality of the learning environment and measurement of student learning, and (iii) improve effectiveness of resource use for primary education.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Primary and Mass Education

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A. 4. | Description :The Recipient shall: (a) ensure timely release of budgetaryallocations and (b) apply suitable internal controls to ensure timely payments and reconciliations and appropriate accounting ofadvances. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A.3. (a) | Description :The Recipient shall establish and thereafter maintain throughoutthe period of the Project implementation, a Technical Committee | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. B. | Description :Commencing May 1, 2012, prepare and furnish to the Association, for itsendorsement, the Annual Plan for the following fiscal year | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C. (a) | Description :Commencing May 31, 2012, carry out joint reviews of the Project andthe Program with the Association and the Co-financiers | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C. (c) | Description :Undertake a Mid Term Review no later than 30 months after theEffective Date | Due Date :07-Jun-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. E.1. and Schedule 2, Section I.E. 2. | Description :Carry out the Project in accordancewith the EMF, the SMF and the Tribal Peoples Plan, and when applicable, prepare and carry out appropriate mitigating measurespursuant to the EMF and SMF. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.1.(a) | Description :The Recipient shall establish and thereafter maintain throughoutthe period of the Project implementation, an Inter-Ministerial Steering Committee | Frequency :Monthly

title.narrative: Decreased disparity in access to schooling measured by family income levels: ratio of NER of 20% poorest to NER of 20% richest
Utility of the learning assessment system
Frequency and quality of assessment of learning of primary education completers (Grade 5 completion exam)

baseline.value: Grade 5 completion exam implemented for first time in 2009 to all students: testing memory more than ability to use subjectknowledge

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level
Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) systems strengthened to improve monitoring and data utilization for program performance and planning:number of months to administer & disseminate Annual School Census
Adequate learning resources: percentage of schools receiving textbooks within first month of academic year (Percentage, Core)
Number of additional qualified primary teachers resulting from project interventions.
Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Strengthening Upazilas for supporting school management: proportion of Upazilas having prepared Upazila Education Plans and receiving funds (Percentage, Custom)
Provision of Pre-Primary Education (PPE) in Government Primary Schools (GPS) (GPS providing PPE [trained teachers and PPE material availability])

target.value: PPE provision (trained teachers and PPE materials availability in at least 75% of the 37,000 GPS

title.narrative: Classroom environment more conducive to learning: percentage of schools meeting minimum quality standards per Primary School Quality Level Indicators (PSQL) (Percentage, Custom)
Expanded coverage of decentralized planning and management at school levels: proportion of schools preparing School Level Improvement Plans and receiving funds
Increase in the number of children enrolled in primary education
